text: UPDATED: JUN 17, 2017 37,5 cl bottle, served in a tumbler. Vintage: 2015/2016. Poured clear golden amber with a small half finger off white head. Loads of carbonation in glass. Aroma: barnyard, goat, blue cheese, citrus, menure, basement, leather, hay, rotten leaves in the autumn woods. Taste: sour but not overwhelming, citrus, oak, dry vinous tannine, granny smith apples, tart, vinegar, bitter, blue cheese, barnyard, clove, earth, cherries, leather, ginger. Very complex with a very sweet explosion of different tastes going on every time when you sip it. Love it how you can still taste the oak barrels and the bitterness in this piece of art, very champagne-like. I am drinking this how it is supposed to be drunk, at room temperature and loving every divine sip of it. Medium body with a long dry and sour bittersweet finish. A delicious piece of art, I tip my hat to monsieur Pierre Tilquin...Bravo!
375ml bottle shared with friends. Somewhat pale golden with almost no head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice sour tones with subtle sweetness. Tart, oak and grapes. Nice.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden , almost no head. Aroma: sourish, white vine vinegar, gooseberry, play-do, meadow, hay, some acidity- really smooth. Taste: Nice sour, nice acidity, hay and apple puree where is now juice- well balanced. Nice sour-acidity finish.

Practically all Belgian Lambics are special, but Gueuze is a rare sighting in my area. I couldnt pass up the chance. Hell, its good to give in to temptation. This brew from Tilquin is sinfully drinkable. Gold color and a frothy, white head. Aroma is equally champagne-like with bright yeast esters, sour apple, and stone fruit. Flavor is damn cider-like (just more sour) with more subtle notes of grape must, citrus, barnyard, and wood. Finish is long and dry. This brew lands a perfect balance between massively funky and beautifully approachable.

Super funky green apple medium sour. Cracking drop buy again and pit one down for a year 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazed golden with a sudsy white head. Funky aroma. Light body funky with a moderate lemon tartness. Excellent balance. 

Notes: Bottle from top shelf.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2017 Bu en cours de zythologie. Verre de 25cl issue d?une bouteille de 75cl.Couleur cuivre léger pas de brillance ! Pas de mousse, peu de gaz et peu de bulles .Au nez : citronnelle , fruit sec , pomme macérer et acidulée. En bouche : peu de pétillant en bouche ! Acidité assez sympa pas trop peu bien dosée. Note de noix séché. Un peu de citronnelle .Pas d?amertume 0 ! Le houblon n?intervient pas !Sensation de pomme macéré type cidreux je trouve .Agréable et bonne gueuze
Colossal aroma of sour green apples. Taste is plenty of apples with some black pepper. Fairly tart and dry.

Aroma: spoiled green apple, sour, barnyard.
Appearance: Like apple juice with small white head.
Taste: Medium sourness, green apple, barnyard.
Palate: light body, light carbonation, long sour finish.

Bottle from 2016 thanks to klimaet. Aroma of tart green stonefruit, lactic acid, nice funk fresh brett. Amber colour, white head. Taste is moderate sour and dry. Light body, dry oily feel, sour brett stonefruit finish.
Trübes dunkles Orange mit reichlich Schaum. Säuerlich, leicht fruchtig, Zitrusaromen, Apfel, etwas Pfeffer, spritzig.
Bottle pour at ACBF2017. Pours cloudy golden, small white head. Fruity, peach, citrus, funk, some wood, moderate sourness, tart. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.

@ Brussels, Belgium Beer Trip. pour golden without a head. aromas of grape, lemon, and wood barrel. taste medium sour, bitter notes. medium bodied, lively carbonation, medium sour finish 

<><> Beeroda.hu - Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary <><>
Dry Gueuze rather sour taste. Very good old Gueuze. Dark blond colour. Small head that quickly disappears. One of the best Gueuzes I had

Panelowo Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Gueuze Tilquin à LAncienne (2015-2016) by Gueuzerie Tilquin at Saska Kępa

Delikatne, lekkie, dosc malo kwasnosci i dosc malo dzikosci, strasznie fajnie poukladane, owocowe, mrau, do picia wiadrami
2015/2016. W zapachu skórki winogron, w smaku owocowo, trochę słodyczy i cierpkości na finiszu.
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Belgia którą kocham. W aromacie wioskowe klimaty.Stajnia, konie derka. Nuty owocowe i trocheę palonosci .Owocowo kwaśne. Ściągające na finiszu.
Beer tasting @ Fillepolo. Bottle from belgolådan, Pours a golden colour beer with a smal head. Fruity and bretty with green apples and wood. Dry finish.
Beer tasting at Fillepolo 170310. Bottle from Belgolådan. Sour and magic!!!

F: not big, white, not long lasting.
C: gold with light orange hue, hazy.
A: citrus, barnyard, fruity, woody, brett, vinegar, funky.
T: citrus, barnyard, woody, brett, hint of cheese, sour green apple, medium body, medium to high carbonation, not bad is a joke I mean very good, 37,5cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck.
Aroma of citrus, barnyard, horseblanket. Appearance is golden / copper. Has a medium sourness and a dry finish. No sediment in the bottle. Good gueuze.

Birra con un bouquet di aromi interessanti: citrico, erbaceo, frutta matura, legno, agrumi e fieno. In bocca si ripropongono le stesse note olfattive cui si aggiungono note tanniniche rilasciate da una lunga maturazio e in botte.
Sample, yellow golden small head. Aroma is sour, vinegar, lemon/citrus/fruit, barnyard. Taste is the same... not for me.

Backlog, bottle shared with friends. Pours a golden/orange liquid, with a small white head disappearing quite fast. Aromas are funky, barnyard, citrus zest. Very good spontaneous beer, medium sourness, low bitterness, quite fruity, tart, funk. Loved it!

Bière opaque dorée sans mousse comme toutes les bières de fermentation spontanée. Nez citronné, attaque en bouche acide surprenante vu le nez peu prononcé. Légère amertume et fin fruitée agrumée qui rapproche cette bière de certains cidres ou vin de fruit.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Profil jak w zielonym 3F.

Pours clear and ruby red. Has medium lactic acid sourness. Very clean malt profile perfectly balanced by the low low bitterness. Not fruity at all, very nice beer that tastes like a true lambic. Co-op bottle.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Przy otwarciu poderwało sie sporo osadów więc sie zmętniło. 
Leje sie pomarańczowe idealne zmętnienie spore, piana szybko sie redukuje 
Zapach świetna derka kocham bretty, stajnia,kuń,skóra,owoce pomarańcza,nawet owoce tropikalne :D 
Smak kwaśny dość w cytrusowy sposób,limonka, owoce tropikalne,stajnia, lekko cierpkawe 
wysycenie dość wysokie
Najlepsze Gueze jakie w życiu piłem, troszkę jeszcze kwaśne ale wydaje mi sie że jakby dać mu czas to zacznie urywać dupy

W zapachu mocna stajnia, skórzany but wyciągnięty z piwnicy, koń. Nie jest bardzo intensywny aromat, tak jak np w Hanssensie, ale jest zdecydowanie wyraźny. W zapachu tylko lekka, trochę owocowa kwaśność. 
Smak oddaje to co się działo w zapachu, są intensywne smaki brettowe, również skóra, stajnia. Owocowa kwaskowatość. Przy przełykaniu cierpkie aż. Piwo naprawdę leciutkie, ale nie wodniste, wchodzi idealnie. Nie jest to piwo w żadną stronę przegięte, bardzo fajny balans. No i intensywność całościowa piwa jest też na fajnym poziomie, można spokojnie wypić całą butelkę, a pewnie i ze dwie, co np w przypadku wspomnianego przeze mnie Oude Gueuze z Hanssensa jest czasami ciężkie. 
Polecam ;)

pours a hazy orange with a small, quickly dissipating head. Nose is lots of funk, barnyard, aged cheese, a bit earthy. Taste is more funk, with a fullish body and light carbonation. Very balanced sourness.

Draft. Clear golden body. Fizzy, short off-white head, rapidly diminishing. Aroma of basement mustiness, barnyard, sour apple, grape, sour cherry. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly sweet, moderately acidic and lightly bitter. Thin to medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation. Lots of fruit, comfortable tartness with horse blanket taste.

Bottle from Crafted in Haymarket
Aroma: barnyard, sour citrus, barnyard, 
Appearance: slightly hazy golden with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium sourness, 
Palate: medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, dry finish, 

Delicious
Tasting with Alex and George. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is funky, earthy. Taste is earthy, tart, fruity, slightly ascorbic. Good stuff.

Bottle brought home from Belgium.
Nose slightly sour. Taste crisp, nice and sour, with a fruity finish. 
Full body, soft carbonation.

Pale golden color, medium white head. Slight tart aromas with gooseberries, elderberry, apple sauce and vanilla. Tart, almost sour taste with an earthy feel to it. Slight bitter and earthy finish. Not my cup of tea.

Aroma: green pepper, leather, apple, spicy
Taste: light sour, leather, pineapple, spicy, some citrus

Aromat niszczy. Jest elegancki a przy tym dość konkretnie kwaśny. Objawia się niuansami siana, stajni, trawy, młodego, zielonego winogrona oraz cytrusów. Smak zaskakujący, skomplikowany, jedno z bardziej kwaśnych piw, które miałem okazję próbować. Początek słodki, owocowy, finisz zaś mocno wytrawny, trwały. Świetne piwo.

750 ml bottle at Chinaski Lavapies, Madrid. Hazy orange amber color with white to off white head. Yeasty aroma, funky, barnyard, tart citrusy fruity, wood, light vinous. Light sweet, bitter and acidic taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Aroma - dry white flesh fruit, abundant funk, horse blanket sweat, barnyard, and some spiced wheat. All over wild as can be yeast.
Appearance - the body is a hazy golden road, the head is 2" and white. Head lays down to a thin layer of foam.
Taste - is abundantly funky, has some sweated horse blanket, white fruit flesh, the yeast part is wild for sure. High quality lambics like this have a centralized ember that just cant be explained its like the source of the funk. Not sure how to describe it.
Palate - the body is on the lighter side of medium, the texture is slightly vinous the carbonation is lively, the finish is dry and funked.

375ml bottle @ home. 2015-2016 Vintage. Pours a hazy golden colour. Nose is funky and sour. Flavour is a sour and dry with a bite. Always enjoy this gueuze and have been having fun with vinatges. I look forward to sampling this again in time.

Bottle. Pours amber with no head. Scent is light notes of caramel, lambic. Taste is medium dense sour grapes and sweetness of grapes as well. Medium dryness. Merlot. Finish is smooth and a bit lingering dryness. Great. Thanks to Chris at Cork and Cask for organising the bottle share.

Veldig overraskende øl. Første inntrykk var altfor sitruspreget. Både lukt og smak. Men den modnes etterhvert og er god i ganen

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The Sampler, Brooklyn: pours orange with a white head. Aroma is cheesy, musky, and funky. Taste is quite sour. Very complex. Very nice.

MBR Sour Beer Fest. Thanks to whoever got it! Finally some Tilquin! I stupidly missed the draft version more than once in Bruxelles last time thinking I could get it easily... riiight. Misty golden body. Light dry funky aroma. Quite sour dry biting taste, a touch of plastic, but not that off. Yeah, the acidity bite is strong with this one (2012 version). Respectable as unlike some, its still good.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, wood, fruit, barnyard and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with a slight/medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, wood and fruit; ends slightly bitter, dry and sour with barnyard and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Not really sour and rather fruity for a Gueuze. This works wonderful together in creating a fruity and refreshing beer.
pour golden without a head. aromas of grape, lemon, and wood barrel. taste medium sour, bitter notes. medium bodied, lively carbonation, medium sour finish

Aroma is very tart and non-cleaned barnyard. Lemon and wooden notes hurdles together trying to outlive the massive dusty cloud that lingers above them. Lovely! Taste is sour, very much white grapes and complex earthy notes. Amongst all this earth, wind and fire, theres a re-juvenating sourness that just carries all the complex notes to the end where a pleasant acidness takes over, leaving you with a smile on your face (with a slight tad of cringe thrown in for the sourness).

75 cl bottle at Irreale, Madrid. Pours hazy amber-golden with thick, good-lacing, off-white head. Sheer sour aromas of cider, green apple, fermenting yeast, bread dough and leather. Mouthfeel is fizzy, very dry and sour, nicely metallic. Very long yet subtle finish.

Dampolla al BBF-Lab Barcelona 2016. Cervesa color ambre clar una mica tèrbola. Aromes cítrics de llimona i també afruitats de poma i pera. També i trobo cereal, palla, estable i un punt acètic. Final àcid i sec. Bona!
Yellow. On tap at cuginos. Foamy. Smells sour. Tart. Puckering. Very dry. Decent.

750ml bottle. Thank you, Veit! Golden yellow colour. Modest white head. Hints of vinegar, hints of citrusses, hints of horseblanket, leathery notes, hints of spices in the aroma. Very refreshing and complex. Hints of vinegar, citrusses at first. Lots of horseblanket in the middle. Leathery notes. Bitter, slightly spicy, white wine-like finish. Horseblanket in the aftertaste. Rather light bodied, medium carbonated, very well balanced, refreshing gueuze.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with a lasting foamy white head. Aroma is funky, citrus, orange, light caramel, white grapes, tart. Taste is of stone fruit, peaches, tart, funky, citrus, toffee, hay. Oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Erittäin maukas, kirpeä sitruuna, hapokas. Samea, maku kärkeen tukkoinen. Hauska.

37cl bottle at home. Hazy muddy orange with a thin white head. Smells like macerated grapes, unripe apricots, vinegar, barnyard funk. Moderately sour and bitter, much milder than the nose suggested, with a high carbonation and a bitter and sour aftertaste.
Svag syrlig funk duft lidt æble smag syrlig funk æble frisk lidt frisk frugt kant appelsin
Ik was direct verkocht aan deze geuze. Echt een verrijking voor het landschap van de geuzes.
Bottle. Cloudy gold with a large foamy off white head. Aromas of funk, lemon, yeast, and spice. Flavor is tart lemon, funk, yeast, light spice. Light bodied crisp and bone dry.
2014-2015 375ml bottle, golden color, notes of cheese hay and ginger, strong carbonation, medium sourness, light body

2014/2015, 75 cl.
Arancione con riflessi dorati, velata, schiuma bianca poco persistente.
Aroma di legno umido, leggero stallatico e leggera polvere, pelle conciata, pompelmo, uva spina, leggera mela verde, frumento, erbacea ed oleosa.
Al palato acidula, legno umido, frumento, pompelmo e mela verde, note di stallatico, oleosa.
Corpo leggero, medio-leggero, ben carbonata, texture oleosa.

Slightly murky golden blond with orange hue, lasting head. A: green apple, slight barnyard funk, hay, lime and lemon sour, malts, vinous note. T: follows aroma but turns fruity halfway with light cherry note. Tart medium bitter development, malt note, faint bell pepper. Sour aftertaste, lemon line returns.

Bottle shared at a tasting. Hazy orange with a small head. Aroma is funky with notes of white wine, wood, green apples, vinegar. Sour, with flavors of berries, vanilla, oak, lemon, apples and vinegar, dry finish. Medium-bodied, oily palate. Great beer.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom L place. Thanks zvsn. 2013-2014. Hazy golden with off-white head. The aroma has lots of yogurt, very fruity (mostly apricot) with lots of wood. Very sour flavor with notes of yogurt, vinegar, lots of wood, very dry. Lively carbonation, medium-bodied. Amazing stuff.

At a tasting, many thanks, smallish bubbly head, hazy dried apricot orange color, aroma of apples, sour bread vanila and oak, seems young, flavor of sour fruit wood and vinegar, quite strong but mellow sourness. Highly drinkable and Pure enjoyment.
Blend of 2014-2015 , fantastic spicy yeast aroma , with some straw like funk. Light carbonation gives a lemon fizz on the tongue, with a gentle, but long lasting bitter finish.

Blend of 11/12. Bought it back in 2012. Not a big fan of geuze but this was great. Aroma of apple, herbs, barnyard, lemon. Sweet upfront, really dry and of course tart in the aftertaste. Complex. Just enough carbonation.

Aroma pleasant and typical of the style, albeit a bit soft to the nose. Appearance very hazy with thin, quickly disappearing white head. Remaining yeast sticking to the cork as if the bottle was kept horizontal, tilted down even. Taste only mildly sour, bitter aftertaste dominates, less complex than most gueuzes. More carbonated than most gueuzes too. Not the sour, mildly carbonated sensation I assosiate with the style (of which I am a big fan)  After the carbonation has disappeared however,  the taste improves: softer and more sour, aftertaste less bitter.  Still not complex though.  Maybe best to be drunk rather at room temperature than at cellar temperature ( winter).

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 3 oz pour at Hops & Pie. Sour and dry with rustic yeast, oak and light earth in the aroma. Similar flavor, adding a tart, light puckering feel with a crisp finish. Solid gueuze, I think I prefer their draft version though.

Bottled, no idea where i got it from. Cloudy dark golden colored, lasting white head. Beautiful lambic nose, horseblanket, farm, tartness, yeast. Dry flavor, moderately acidic (for a gueuze), yeasty notes, funky, but still pretty clean. Not the most complex gueuze, but very well balanced.

Beatiful lirgt amber-orange color with creamy quite thick head. Aroma: sourish, grape, grass, wine, yeast amd malt. Light body with nice high sourness and bitterness, light sweetness. Excillent body and perfect with yellow pear!

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2016 375ml 2012 bottle from the trade. Aroma: nice dusty fruity nose. Lemon is prominent here with some apples in the background. App: cloudy copper, medium white head with good retention and great lacing. Taste and palate: light body, moderate carbo, soft on the palate, light sweetness, medium lingering acidity finish. Overall: damn good! To me the palate is the perfection. Not too sweet, not too acidified and so refreshing. Cant wait to taste the Prune de Namur that is waiting for me in my beer cellar.

Poured from bottle (2013-14), clear gold with a frothy medium head. Aroma is that of fine champagne with a touch of barnyard. Taste is bubbly for sure with a carefully balanced path between sour and sweet with a touch of bitterness carefully hidden. What a beer!

375ml cork and cage bottle at home in Richmond as Oude Gueuze Tilquin à lAncienne, 6.4%, bottled Feb 2014, pretty aggressive gush. Vibrant dark orange, opaque, sparkling, big dense foamy off-white head endures. Aroma is airy and light until it warms. Some lemon, caramel plastic, copper. Body is light, foamy, tingly carbonation. Taste is tart with lemonade, Tangfastics, light acidity with some metallic notes. Improved as it warmed. A good gueuze, but not top-tier on this showing.
Bottle (2010). Hazy orange color. Aroma: wildness combined with lemon, sour, hay. Taste: very original, sour, but pleasant, citrus, oak, excellent.

0.375 l bottle from Firma Bier, best before November 2024 (I assume bottled in November 2014). Clear, golden yellow with a massive, fluffy, rather quickly diminishing, white head. Sourish-fruity, moderately funky, peppery aroma of leather, lemon, rhubarb, apples, oak and dusty cellar. Fruity, firmly but not overly sour, moderately funky and slightly peppery taste of lemon, rhubarb, leather, oak and apples, followed by a medium long, firmly tart, peppery-dry finish. Thin to medium body, firmly astringent and fizzy mouthfeel, very lively carbonation. The loud plop of the cork already promised a very lively Gueuze which it is. It is rather quaffable due to its comparably moderate acidity, but at the same time complex and elegant, although maybe not as round as it could be. I like it a lot though!

75cl bottle shared. Pours hazy orange golden, small white head. Aroma is acidic with funky notes, sweet, cellar, damp wood. Taste is similar, very well balanced acidity, medium body, lively carbonation. Excellent.

Bouteille de 37,5cl. Couleur dorée limpide, mousse moyenne, tenue correcte. Des arômes citronnés, c est original pour une gueuze, çà lui confère une pointe de fraîcheur . Belle acidité mais bien équilibrée, carbonnation agréable. Trouvée à la brasserie Delneste - Froidmont.

Bottle. Lemony sour aroma with some burnt match, white grape, cranberry, and light caramel. Almost clear golden orange under a lasting, thin, white cover. Very sour cranberry and white grape flavour, with red cherry and light caramel accents. Light body, medium high carbonation, dry and mouth puckering.

Bottle @cafe frape. Haze. Two finger foam. Sour bacillus notes. Quite sour. Low bitterness. Bone dry. Made in wallonien. The only one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours cloudy gold, med white head. Aroma is lemon, citrus, oak, grass. Flavor is fresh lemon grass, oak, funk, barnyard. Fairly light / crushable for a gueuze, great stuff.

Tilquin Oude Geuze Tilquin A LAncienne 2014 6.4%

Pouring a light honey gold with a sense head of foam that lasts for ages.

This Geuze from an underrated and quite new blenderie that is growing in popularity has an intensely funky aroma: earthy with a lightly peppery lemon tartness.

Its got an insanely soft rounded mouthfeel very nice. 

The taste is acidic, cork, light must/funk, lemon drops, a bit salty. Really interesting stuff that I think would go great with a salad or seafood.

37,5 cl bottle. The labelling is very classy. Nice pop at the opening! Golden hazy pour with quite a thick head but like any gueuze, short lasting. Aroma is funky and zesty lemons, apples, light vinegar. There is a massive gunflint mineral aroma that I have not yet found on any other gueuze (it is not as present in Boon, Cantillon, Lindemans, 3 Fonteinen lambics which are used to make this). It is rather sweet for a gueuze, very round and balanced. Dry and sour finish, but very harmonic. The palate is very full with lots of very thin bubbles. Overall it is highly drinkable and incredibly tasty! I only leave one point just in case I find any beer better than this!

06/02/2016 - sample from 75cl bottle @ BAB Beerfestival, Bruges.
Orange copper with smalle head. Nose is wood, sour, apple. Taste is sour, fruit, yeast, some sweetness too. Complex bit Less dry than other gueuzes

Poured into a teku showing lightly filtered dry orange peel with a finger and half of clean white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of intense barnyard and bretty funk.

The palate is well carbonated and light bodied. Moderate sparkling tartness with a very strong citric forward flavor followed by a slight zesty bitterness on the finish.

hazy orange colour, moderate sized off-white head, which disappears fully and quite quickly; aroma of tart, lemony notes, tannins, barnyard, wheat, some vinegar and unripe grapefruit; taste is the same with some bitterness; really great gueuze
Gli odori la fanno da padrone: stantio, leggero ossidato, limone, pelle del salame, lumaca e tanto altro. Grande gueuze.

No official tick of this yet sheeeeeit!!! 2011 vintage. Mostly clear deep golden color with a small lasting white head. Funky barnyard aroma, wild as hell. Medium flavor, funky, dry, yeasty. Medium body, acidic, lively carbs. Good stuff!
herbs, hay, leaves, basement aromas, earthy, woody, golden, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, nice

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 2014-2015 vintage in 37.5cl bottle.

AROMA: Musty maybe even dank or dusty, tropical fruit, parmesan cheese. Extremely pleasant. 

APPEARANCE: Deep amber, translucent, Alive with carbonation. Such a lovely thing. Large white foamy head which after a while dissapates a lot but remains somewhat present along with some residual carbonation.

TASTE: Magnificent, tropical fruits, sour, bubbly, oily, refreshing. Quenching.

PALATE: Long lasting, acidic, quenching, moreish.

OVERALL: A real triumph. I was lucky enough to meet Pierre Tilquin at IMBC and he was a very humble person who was just happy his beer was liked. This really is the real deal.

Bottle.
Orange hazy, white head.
Aroma of cellar, peach, 
Fizzy, tart lovley. Slight sweet and bitter, but fresh sourness to balance.
Great to lobster.

Rating #1487 - 12.03.2015 - Pregaming for Sour & Funk Fest. Bottle from Wine & Beyond Windemere (now HorizonKyle beat beerblast to the punch on this round, must have been a fluke, hahaha) Pours hazy golden with a bubbly white head. Aroma of apricot jelly, lemon juice, and Brett. Quite tart and juicy with a pronounced sourness - lingering acidity into the finish. Phenomenal.
375ml bottle of 2013/14 pours an orangey color with a lot of head. Slight sourness. Bitumen. Great balance.
Cloudy, pale pour with an energetic foam. Good sour character and surprisingly strong. Good dry finish.
2011 versie. Koperkleurig bier met wit schuim dat vlug weg is. Zurige houtgeur. De smaak is zurig, citrus. Een malse zachte geuze.

Bottle. Pours in light hazy pale body with very high head, very high carbonation. Aroma has light brett character with acidic background, more balanced to the acidic side. Taste has higher citrus acidity with sweathy brett background, pretty gentle. Body is full, very high carbonation.

Ive been fortunate enough to have this multiple times but Ill rate the 13/14 bottle I had on 03.18.2014.

TONS of white head when poured - a nice dark golden colored pour. Smell is very tart with lots of floral notes. Super tart taste, too, but not overwhelming. I also get some earthiness and naturalness coming through. The carb is awesome. Super drinkable and I cant wait to get back to Belgium this year.

Clean and nice Gueze, strong taste.
Apparence is golden with low foam.
Taste is a classic belgian gueze and sour.
Overall one of the classic gueze that always delivers.
This is a real quality brew and a symphony of flavors. Very sour and nice taste of brettanomyces.
Borefts 2014. A very funky barnyard with sour grapes. Backlog from 2014/09/26.

Bottle version. Hazy golden color with à small white head. Citrus, hay, fruits, yeast in the aroma. Taste is tart, sour, fruity. Great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted from bottle. Pours a hazy gold with thick white head. Funky fruity sour aroma. Taste is heavily sour tart with fruit notes of apple and lemon. Some yeasty notes. Mouthfeel of a tart champaign. Well done sour lambic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
375 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden with white head. Funky oak, old fruit, green apple and hay. Dry, medium sour with medium to high carbonation.

A big thanks to Matt for this beautiful bottle! Dégustée en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina en accompagnement dun foie gras maison à lapéro. La bière est est absolument magnifique : claire, mousseuse, étincelante dans nous coupes en cristal. De toute beauté! Nez bien balancé de malts et de ces merveilleux lambics savamment concoctés par Pierre. Sèche en bouche, de la pomme verte, du funk avec modération et acidité tout aussi travaillée. Assez courte et peu fruitée, il est difficile de ne pas boire cette bière dun trait!

When I met a young Wallonian guy in Brussels in 2007, a friend of Yvan De Baets of the Brasserie de la Senne, and he told me he intended to start a lambic brewery, I was admittedly a bit sceptic. But he persisted and see, here was the first result, since May 2011, a geuze initially only made with Lindemans, Boon and Cantillon lambics. Cream white, stable head, hazy orange blonde colour. The aroma has all the funkiness, esteriness and complexity you would expect from a true geuze, with hay, gooseberry, wood, green apple, wine vinegar, sweat, sour cream, barnyard... Mellow fresh sour taste with refreshing lemon touch, quite soft mouthfeel with less sharp carbonation than usual for the style, tart, complex enough and finishing long and dry with woody hints. Has further improved since then and now stands equal to all the traditional geuzes we know and love.

Appearance: Hazy darker shade of orange with a light white film of bubbles on the surface. No lacing.

Smell: I get this odd smell of popcorn. It is followed by a familiar musty cellar smell. Kudos for having something new...never smelled popcorn in beer before.

Taste: Strong sour apple flavor, like green Jolly Ranchers. Quickly this is taken over by funky old house...if that were a flavor. Then I get some of the popcorn.

Mouthfeel: Very dry and tart feeling. A sipper. 

Overall: Its a very good Gueuze that already tastes like it has a good deal of age on it. While its possible to drink it fresh, It has a "best before" date of 08/01/2024 on the bottle. I will revisit this beer somewhere down the line when it has aged out some more. That "popcorn" flavor and aroma is very strange. It doesnt taste bad, it just tastes odd. Un-aged I would not drink another bottle.
A: Hint of oak, dandelions, balsamico T: again hint of oak, balsamico vinegar (without the sticky touch) Overall: Great beer! Really enjoy this one! (2012/2013)

750 ml bottle. 6%. BB 11/12/2020. From a webshop long time ago.
Cloudy slightly reddish golden colour with a tiny white head. 
Vinegar, red berries, tartness, sourness and leather in the aroma. 
The flavour is very tart and sour... redcurrant and mild vinegar. 
Tasty. Mouth-watering.

Pour hazy light orange, with a huge semi frothy white head. 
Aroma is nice mix of funk, barnyard, brett, citrus, slight pear peel.
Taste is pretty sour, but nicely complex. Medium bodied, with a fizzy carb.

750ml bottle, Pours hazy golden brown, a bit of red, with a small white head. Classic gueze yeast aromas, very funky and sour, but this this has great balance with ittle astringency, lively carbonatin, very dry on the finish.

37.5 cl bottle at home. 2011 bottling. Cork escapes with explosive force, pours with some effervescence. Aroma is not a harsh as some gueuzes, more fruity but with some mustiness. Appearance is hazy amber with a nice small white head. Taste is excellent, sharp and sour, lemony bith a dry bitterness. Good body, quite high carbonation. Finish is long and dry with some tart berry fruit. Overall a fine gueuze, not as astringent as some but very drinkable.

Bottle @ BBF 14. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma has that classic stable gueuze smell along with some goose berries, vinegar, funky barnyard and some hay. A nice and tart aroma. Taste is pretty tart with some sour citrus fruits, lime, funky barnyard and dry leather. Really good gueuze here! I enjoyed!

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2014 15cl tasting from a 75cl bottle @ Borefts Beer Festival. Beautifully darkened yellow, hazy colour, white foamy head. Tard vinegar, green apple, white wine and lemon tones but also big barnyard earthiness. Quite balanced despite the big flavours. Prickling, astringent mouthfeel and carbonation, good body.
Borefts. Hazy orange brown with small white head. Massive funk and barnyard, sour grapes and green apple. Nice grainy backbone with a vegetal bitter finish. Very good gueuze.

"Nice lively barnyard aroma, with some lemon and green olives. Bubbly, slick slighty gassy feel. A little clean for the style, but quite good. Decent amount of tartness keeps ones attention focused."

375ml bottle from trade with angst. Thanks. Pours a hazy copper color with a small white head that soon recedes to a fine film. The aroma is big and bold with sour fruits and some barnyard funk. The taste is sour grapes, a bit of sour apricot and funky hay. The palate is light but effective and the carbonation is lively. Finishes long with lingering sour apricots. Overall: Very tasty--me like.

Hazed bronze, after the bottom is disturbed. The distant aroma offers some guava, and the familiar gruyere rind funk in careful distribution. Calcium deposits are plentiful. Wet dog, some brine, some dirty beach; lots of nostalgic, evocative stuff. 


Juicy, tart, sharp flavor. Watermelon, golden kiwi. Hard water minerals and soft limestone gravel. Gorgeous balance and subtlety. Bitter, whitish wooden notes become apparent with time. There is no stark, violent action to this one, but the quiet elegance of its bright fruit and cloudy funk is sufficient for an impressive experience.

Puckering palate whisks away moisture but is not overpoweringly sour. The mid to late palate has a mild hollowness to it. The finish shows high acidity with pineapple, lactic acid, goat cheese. It is ultimately somewhat clean. This could merit multiple visits, for its impeccable balance and easy character.
Very grapefruit like. Tasty sour. Very nice. Better than the 3F I thought. ........

Bottle 0.375l. Pours hazy amber yellow with white head. Aroma is tart, funky, apples, lemon, hints of vinegar. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, heavy sour, lemon, apples, dry. Aftertaste is acidic, sour, slightly bitter, fruity. Excellent rather mild and fruity geueze.

Bottle from Hop City. Drinking in honor of JHeath99s bday. Pours clear straw-ish in color with lingering white head. Aroma of moldy fruit and something sweet. Taste is lip-puckering sour. The most sour beer Ive ever put in my mouth. Its tangy as well, with hints of apples and cherries. A good beer for those who like sours.

Draught at GBBF 2014. Poured a hazy golden colour with a dense white head. Aroma of popcorn, hay and candy sugar. Tart fruit flavours, with some dry straw and unripened fruit. Finish was very dry, with some tangerine and hay.
Bottle. In aroma very good wild notes and sourness. In taste is sour, with some salty notes. Low bitterness. Medium-low carbonation.

cloudy amber color with a low but persistent white head, good carbonation, thin feel, yeasty aromas of basement, barnyard and cheese, sour and sweet and complex after-taste, dry and a bit astringent finish

Bottle at GH (student pub), Uppsala 20140822. Hazy straw with a minimal head. Aroma of old musty apples, barnyard, lactic acid, cherries. Taste is similar, with small notes of acetic acid, acetone and cyanide. There is also green apple peels, oak and vanilla tones. A bit aggressive mouthfeel.
Aroma is malts, tart/sour notes and a hint of mustiness. The flavor is apples, fruit, malts, mild sweetness and a long and very tart/dry finish.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden with a layer of off cream colored head. Aroma of funk and lemon juice. Taste the same. Amazing.

Bottle from 2010/2011. Yeah! Absolutly Great acid Lambick. Super wytrawny i drazliwie kwaskowaty, koloru jasnego bursztyna z niewielka piana, ale na poczatku sie tworzyla i niestety znikla jak w dobrym szampanie. Kwaskowate lekko pachnace potem i skura. Ziemiste posmaki i zepsuta pomarancza. Wspaniale do panierowanej piersi z kurczaka, solidny korek glosno dal sie zdjac ale bez wystrzalu. Piwo ostrawe i drapiace w przelyk, nie polecam ludzia nie znajacym sie na rzeczy i nie rozumiejacym tej wspanialej belgijskiej starej tradycji.

2010 / 2011 tasted 2014 at Chriss place.

Diaper funkiness drives the nose. Very Tilquin. Cheese and lemon juice. All about the funk. Enjoyable, and clearly a special beer. For me it lacks that extra something that makes Cantillon magic, but I completely see how someone else could find it even that much better.
8/10/2014. 375 ml. bottle. Cloudy amber color with a white head. Tart, funky, yeasty aromas. Acidic, tart, malty flavors. The finish is dry and acidic. A bit of oak mid palate. Awesome brew.
Cloudy amber coloured beer with a small stable white head. Nice complex acidic, grain and lambic in the nose. Flavour is mild acidic, a bit malty and watery. (Corked Bottle 37,5cl)

Bottle 2012/13. Pours hazy orange with a quickly dissipating white foam leaving a lid on the surface. Aroma is fresh and old tart berries, lemon peel, vinegar, yeast, citrus and an obligatory hint of barn and hay. Taste is freshly tart backed up with a slight complex wall of malt, wood and grass. Again a moderate vinegar and tart berry tone. Ends dry and semi sour. Medium to full body, medium carbo with oily texture. Not that overly rough and tart as some lambics can be, this has an elegant complexity to it, amazing.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 75cl, one of many. This blended lambic is beautifully put together. Craftmanship of the highest standard. Pours a stunning foam head and has a different tasting character when cooled or served at room temperature. Prefer a one year old bottle. Pillowy hazy head, soft, cheese, basement aromas. Start with prominent taste and dials down to support the primal taste : sourness with a hidden sweet touch in the background, wood, dry lemon zest, barnyard... extremely balanced and full bodied! Amazing old gueuze!

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with an average, frothy, short lived, off-white head that laces. Tart, fruity aroma with notes of citrus, brettanomyces and barnyard. Sweet, acidic flavour with notes of fruit, citrus, brettanomyces and a dry, sour finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation.

Bottle. Cork flew out, but I was ready...

Noe is is funk, horse blanket, a touch of honey, lots of dust, yeast, drop of syrup. Taste is sour with a deep tart finish. Richer than many lambics, it has fruity green apple, lemon, pear leading to tart finish with a slight sweet honeyish note undercutting the tartness. 

The mouthfeel is surprisingly carbonated. A very good balanced lambic.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2015 Bottle shared thanks at arts. Poured light hazy gold peach color with min white head. Aroma of sweet honey fruit. Light carb med bod. Pretty sour taste. Sour.

Again in Belgium.
2014 Bottle at Nuetnigenough. Poured clear amber with thinned white head. Aroma musky dank basement sweet malt. Light carb med bod. Taste lil barn sulphur dry.

375ml bottle thanks to ruigo. Head is thin, color is dark gold to orange. Taste is medium sour and bitter and low sweet. Quite balanced. Nice balanced body. Nice aroma of banana, wheat, citric, fruit, hops and herbs.

750 ml bottle reading 2011/2012. After uncaging, cork shoots itself into the ceiling and the beer proceeds to gush a third of the bottle into the sink (Im getting better and opening beers in the kitchen). Appearance: hazy light gold with a lot of rocky white head that doesnt stick around for more than a minute or two. No real lacing. Aroma: tart lemon; musty; horse blanket funk (starts off very prominent, but dials itself down in short order to just play a supporting role). Taste: lemon, tart (but pretty restrained), somewhat funky. Surprisingly refreshing. Palate: light body, effervescent carbonation; crisp, refreshing. Overall: a different beast of a lambic than Cantillon, but fully delicious in all regards.

An excellent lambic! Only got to have a taste of it at a local bar, but it was well worth it! Just attempting to break into the lambic/sour craze, so would love to try it now that I am in love with these styles!

Hazy light orange, it looks delicate; minimal head; aroma is apples, funk and zest; taste is uncompromisingly sour, apples, white grapes, white wine; ok, but I didnt find it as compelling as the 3 Fontainen or Boon examples.

Pours a slightly hazy orangeish copper color with one finger head which rapidly dissipates. Aroma - lots of farmyard funk, yeast, white grapes(?), sourness. Taste - sour with some sweetness underneath, tart apple, white grape juice, yeast and a touch of funk to finish it off. Somewhat oily on palate, full- bodied with a long finish.
Average off-white head, lasting. Hazy orange. Funky, peppery, woody, sour aroma. Sour, light sweetness, dry, astringent finish.
Det här var en riktig höjdare enligt min mening, smaken var kraftfull med toner av plommon och syra. Kroppen och balansen var i toppskick vilket höjde hela upplevelsen ett par snäpp.

Bouteille 375ml. Couleur orangée translucide, mousse blanc cassé évanescente. Arôme de brett, acidité, pomme verte, paille humide. Goût de brett, grande acidité, pomme verte, rafraîchissante. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen, huileuse.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2015 A pale ambered beer with a soft white head. 
On the nose white grape and yeast aromas. 
lightbody. 
Sour but not much, too watering notes.
The finish is a bit dry and acidic.
Pours hazy yellow with thin white head. A: very tart, pear, peach. T: horse blanket, apple, tart, pear, sour finish that leaves a faint metalic taste. Light body. Very good gueuze.

375ml bottle, provided by Northern Monk Brian. Cheers! Murky, dark orange. Glossy, tiny bubbled, lasting, nearly white head. Cider apple ice-lolly. Bay leaf. Light pepper. Taste is spicy dry, with a sourness thats fairly restrained, really. Palate is perfect. Champagnesque crispness. Finish is dry and sour. Very nice.

Pours a glowing orange-amber color, with a fizzy, small head. Very sour, fruity aromas with tart notes among subtle hints of white wine and vinegar. Begins slightly sour with a notable fruitiness of lemon rind and unripe peach, also musty yeast which helps to keeo the beer in balance. Then sour, dry acidity becomes more and more detectable. It hits the palate in an intense, but refreshing way. The sourness in this Gueuze goes through different stages on the palate. At first, defined by a subtle fruitiness, then with slick yeast and soft yogurt notes, to finish with a dry, tart aftertaste.

2014-05-19. Lightly hazy golden amber body with a small white head that fades. 3+ Aroma is pretty funky, lightly fruity, lemon, grass. 7+ Flavour is moderately sour throughout, lightly funky throughout, whisper of barnyard, sourness grows slightly as you go. Average plus bodied palate, soft carbonation. Relatively simple compared to some but tasty. Bottle close to a year old from Hill Farmstead, Vermont
A very good oude gueuze from this small brewery,complex, fruity, wild, very sour and so drinkable!

375 ml bottle from 2012/2013. Shared at Jeffs. Drank two weeks ago and forgot to rate so this is from memory. Will revisit later. Aroma was rotting wood, lemons, light barnyard, and sour apples. Tasted moderately sour, lots of wood, vinegar, barnyard, and lemon. I remember thinking this probably about as good as it will get for me with a gueuze. Its a style Ive still only had a few of and usually like, but have never been amazed with yet.
It's a sourbomb. Very very delicious for those who like h+. Horse, pigs, urea, wood, minerals, there everything you are looking for. One of my favorites geuze.

A strongly bubbling, dark yellow beer, a head is blond and big. The nose is strongly sour, earthy, lether saddle, apples and soem grapes. Taste is very sour, grapes, apples and lether. Some sugary stickyness in the end. Medium bodied but still light to drink, strong carbonation, refreshning. Huge sourness, tastefull and refreshning.

Bu en bouteille de 37.5cl, couleur ambrée grosse effervescence et petite mousse rapidement déliquescente, en bouche grosse attaque sur les agrumes citron pour commencer avec un final sur le pamplemousse agréable

Clear golden colour with minimal head. Cereal and apples on the nose and even some old hops.. Maybe its hay or some other farm quality. The taste is less metallic than Cantillons bio gueze and with citrussy notes as well. The aftertaste is mouthwatering and juicy and not as drying as theese can sometimes be. Really nice.

Bottle 0,75l. Pours a hazy gold with a slight, off-white ring. Aroma of grapes s lemon. Taste is tart and sweet white grape. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Oranje goudkleur, weinig schuim. Heerlijke zure gueuze-lucht. Smaakt lekker, bijzonder zuur, bittere nasmaak. Topper.
grass, citrus, herbs, golden, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour

Bottle:
Pours a hazy gold with a slight, off-white ring.
White grape, lemon aroma.
Taste is tart and sweet white grape....a bit of basement funk.
Refreshing and sharp.
Very good.

dark yellow, small white foam; vinegar, citrus, little bit funky; strong sourness, little bit bitter, tart; light body, thin but "sharp"?, quite lively carbonation, long tart and sour finish;
Overall: great beer in every way

Bottle from Beers Of Europe [050514] 
Amber, hazy, white head that dissipates
Aroma is funky, tart, sour acidic lemon, fresh aroma, slightly musty
Taste - Very tangy straight away, dry lemon zest, funky barnyard, lemon citrus, seems less complex than some gueuzes Ive had
Palate - Medium carb, quite a light body, tart, fairly sour, refreshing palate. Finish is very dry, getting a hint of cereal in there
Overall - A nice gueuze, less challenging and more drinkable than others ive tried
Bottle. Cloudy yellow with large white head. Aroma of yeast, pear, strong tartness, some alcohol. Medium body, moderate sweetness and tartness, some medicinal notes with a little CO2 burn.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow. Funky barnyard in the nose. Loads of green apple and a little lemon in the taste. Really dry.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Funk, barnyard and apple. Taste is very good, nice sourness, turns into some apple grape with a very nice funk finish, some lemon character to it, and the green apple grape component really grows the more you drink of it, very dry, and not that carbonated.

Bottle. Musty, yeasty dry grape and apple malt aroma. Hazy golden yellow with moderate head. Sweet-tart white wine and malt flavor. Light musty cellar finish. Superbly blending of sour and sweet. Spectacular.
oro leggermente torbida buona acidita legno aceticonlattico in lieve amaro scorza di limone secca

A pale ambered lightly hazy beer with a soft white head. On the nose white grape, green apple and some yeast aromas develop. The texture is somewhat soft or mild with a medium body. Pretty sour with some unexpected light sweet tasting notes. the finish is a bit dry and acidic.

75cl bottle @ Homo Sibaris, enjoyed with two more friends (25cl each). Served in Cantillon glasses. Pours intense orange, somewhat hazy, with small white lasting head on top. The aroma is green apples, yeast, and hints of white grape (pretty intense overall). The flavour was expecting to be very sour, yet it came out incredibly balanced: acid lemon along with malts and the aged hops. Nice yeasty notes retained on the palate. Medium body, perfect carbnation. Great Gueuze.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 Pours slightly hazy (first glass) to cloudy (second glass) pale gold with one finger of loose foamy head diminishing gradually to a dense half finger cap, spotty lacing. (4/5) Nose is dusty barnyard funk, green apple, lemon, woody and vinous notes. (9/10) Taste is mild to moderate sweet, strong tart, mild funk. (9/10) Light body, prickly to moderate carbonation, very dry tart funky finish. (4/5)

OK, I figured Id do this one a precursor to the Quetsche, and kinda forgot that I had reviewed it before. But its so good, theres not much harm in me reviewing it again! Not much negative to say here: great depth of flavour, well-behaved funk, and immense tartness cut only slightly by the mild sweetness. Im fairly convinced I can smell and taste the Cantillon lambic component in this. Much as I love tartness, though, I think its just the tiniest bit unbalanced, with a bit too much emphasis on the tart overwhelming the more subtle aspects. (18/20)

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2014 Bottled. Pours hazy golden with a  large off-white head. Aroma of barnyard, horse blanket caramel, wood notes and citrus. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Light to medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. A great  and crisp Lambic Oude Gueuze.

Bottle 375 ml, c&c, poured into a tulip. ABV 6.4%
Very deep golden orange colour on the body, slight hazy with a tall white head, froathy and with low retetnion. Minimal lacing on the glass.
Subtle aroma of peaches, sugar. Quite sour taste, with white grapes, vinous notes, light citric flavours too.Medium thin body, average carbonation, quite tart on the palate.
Overall very good, one of the better ones I had till now.

Color anaranjado y turbio con espuma blanca y densa. Aromas de fruta verde, ácidos y dulce con brett. En boca es densa con inicio dulce y afrutado, picos equilibrados de acidez que van ganando intensidad hasta el final y duran hasta el regusto. Muy rica.

Pours straw color, hazy with foamy white head. Aroma is a bit musty with some fermented fruits. Taste reminds me of aged white wine. Not everyone will enjoy the "funk" flavor in the middle, it's just a hint but it's there. Dry finish.

Pours cloudy golden color with bubbly white head. Musty fruity aroma with some spicy yeast. Champagne bubbly feel in mouth. Very dry beer. Some crab apple flavor spicy yeast notes followed with a grapefruit zest bitterness.
UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 375ml bottle. Hazy yellow body with a white medium head. Stable, citrus, green apples. Dry, with champagne flavors from the yeast.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2015 A great gueuze, probably the best Ive had yet. Very dry with notes of champagne, sour apples, and weird Belgian yeast (horse blanket, of course). Light bodied, somewhat astringent. Cant wait to age some of these and see how it matures.

2011-2012 375mL bottle. 
Aroma is moderately fruity with some light stone fruit with lemon and cherry pie. Light lactic acid aroma and faint acetate c note. Moderately strong barnyard and horse blanket funk with a medium low earthy, herbal character. 
Pours a slightly cloudy, pale, golden orange with a moderately thick, faintly off white head with surprisingly good retention. 
Flavor has a medium strong acidity, but it is only faintly sharp. Both lactic and to a much lighter extent acetic acid are present. Light lemon notes with some faint stone fruit. Moderate earthy and slightly herbal note. Moderately strong barnyard and horse blanket funkiness. Medium light phenolic note with light oak. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall one of the better gueuzes on the market; its a shame its so expensive and difficult to find though. Nice complexity to both the acidity and funkiness with a well balanced earthy character.
Dunkel gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av frukt og gjær. Smak av frukt og gjær. Vinøs. Sur og salt. Vinmonopolet.
Fin syrlig duft av sitron. Dunkel lys gulbrun farge. Tynt dekkende skum. Frisk litt salt/syrlig smak. Leskende.
75cl baixa carbonatació. Gueuze molt compensada i poc "salvatge" molt indicada per iniciar-se en el mon de les fermentacions espontànies.

375 mL bottle courtesy of Tyson, served in a snifter. Pours hazy orange-golden with a small off-white head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves no lace. The nose has notes of grass, barnyard, apples and sour fruit. The flavour is intensely sour with plenty of sour fruit and apples, along with oaky-woody notes. The finish is long, sour and fairly dry with sour fruity notes. On the palate it is medium in body with a milky texture and soft carbonation. Overall this is a great gueuze. Complex and elegant, assertive and balanced. 2014-03-08
Una gueuze che è quasi poesia, con unacidità morbida e intrigante che avvolge il palato, arricchita da note vinoso-acetiche, che sfumano in uno sfondo citrico e legnoso. Assolutamente stupenda!!

Pours a hazy light copper with a thick bubbly white head. Aroma is barnyard, apples, and a bit woody. Tastes like bitter apple cider and flower peddles. Strong sour mouthfeel, quite bubbly,  with a lingering dry bitter finish. First Sour Ive had, so a little bit shocking. Not sure what I think, but every sip is growing on me.

Pours a clear golden color with a think moussy white head that has great retention. Aroma is sour, horse blanket, barnyard, wheat, cotrus(green apple, grapefruit) and some light oak. Taste is lots of tannin, moderate sour character with barnyard, wheat, horse blanket and some lightly well balanced sweet fruity flavors. Also some grapefruit and oak is present. Medium light body and great balance make the high sourness and puckering so delightful.

Flaske 0,75l fra Vinmonopolet, Bestillingsutvalget. Delt med flere under seanse på Tårnrommet 23 Apr 13. Åpner med et lite puff og litt røyk. Lys gylden. Høyt luftig, skinnende hvitt skum. Litt uklar. Spredte partikler. Litt lacing. Syrlig fruktaroma. Holder seg syrlig. Litt uvariert.

Medium white head. Slightly hazy orange body with carbonation.
Funky fruity barnyard aroma with wooden waxy notes. Sweet-acidic
lemony barnyard taste with funky wooden notes. Mid-bodied. Mild
mouthfeel. Dry vinegary wooden metallic aftertaste with lemony
funky notes. Interesting, and much cleaner than other Tilquin
beers Ive had. Quite nice, and surprisingly sweet
initially. (0.75l bottle from wine monopoly, Vika, Oslo.)

Ive had this a few times over the years, either in 375 or 750ml bottles, and no matter what, its just fucking excellent. Everything a gueze should be. Nice and grass filled, puckery, barnyard funked the fuck out, and lingering for minutes and minutes until you have to make yourself take another sip (because you want to savor it forever). Its worth the asking price. Drink it warmer.

Usual cork and caged 37.5 cl bottle: BBD 12 Apr 2021. Shared between four at the first ever Shrewsbury bottle share on 27th Jan 2014.

Cooking apples!

I dont drink cider and I certainly dont drink old dry cider: it reminded me of that.

Aroma di cantina e pelle sullo sfondo con profumo citrico, aroma di prugne e vino bianco.
Leggermente velata con colore abrato verso larancione.
il gusto è acido che pulisce e fa salivare, presenza di minerali che danno un sapore di minerale e umami, umami, 
buona

From a bottle to a tulip. Light copper slightly opaque pour with fizzy white head and nice lacing with champagne bubbles climbing the glass. Barnyard funk, over ripe fruit and acidity. Complex flavor profile, lemon, sour cherry and raspberry... My taste buds are dancing! First sample of this style for me, I'll be back...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Murky sandy golden, fusty ringed head. Musty, crusty lambicyness. Really smooth, lightly sweety juicy jolly rancher. Refreshing and sour. Light tangy dark dried fruit. Frothy light enough mouthfeel forward and light tang cloy on finish. Yessssssss. Bottle, February Tasting, Cheers BenH

Hazy, yellow-orange colour with huge head lasting to the bottom. Nice lacing too. Very intensive aroma of barnyard, yeast and sourness. Sourness totally dominate on tongue. Very dry. High carbonation. Only for lambic fans :-)

375ml bottle (11/12 blend) pours semi-clear pale orange with a small thin head. Nose is complex barnyard funk, subtle citrus, and grains. The nose is so inviting. Taste is tart crisp subtle lemon funk and layers of barnyard and hayfield swirling around. Finish is dry tart orange zest and funky wood. Wonderful.
375ml bottle courtesy of John at the 1st Shrewsbury Bottle Share Jan 14. Intensely sour geuze with strong tart citrus and an acute acidity that hits spots I didnt know were there!

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2014 Green 12.7 oz bottle, 2012-2013 edition big thanks to phatdog1. Awful skunky aroma. Complex taste of lemon, cranberry, apple, light funk, acidic, and barnyard cheese. Medium carbonation, thin oily body. 1st Gueuze Ive tried, idk what to think about it quite honestly, so take this rating with a grain of salt.
Pours a cloudy orange color with white head. Funky, barnyardy, aroma with some mild citrus. Lots of citrus, fruity dominant, some mild funk and barnyard flavor.
Bottle share thanks to DexFace. Pours golden yellow with white head. Aroma is tart, funky. Taste is light, refreshing, and just slightly tart. Really nice.

Poured from the bottle into a crystal glass. Clear golden yellow. Sunshine in a glass. Light yellow head. Aroma is citrus, lemon drop, yeast, coriander, and a hint of vinegar. Flavour is stunning sour citrus that hits the roof of your mouth. Awesome finish. I love this Gueuze!

Botella de 37.5 cl en cimmeria 14-07-2013. 6.4 Vol. Color ámbar miel turbio con espuma Blanca no muy persistente. Aromas ácidos bastante intensos. Sabores también bastante ácidos y finos asemejándose a cava. Cuerpo ligero, medio con bastante gas. Muy peculiar, algo muy peculiar que se merece repetir de nuevo.
Better in the bottle than on draft. This is a 2012. Freaking fantastic. Smells like an illicit substance. Amazing sour flavor that is freaking amazing of apricots and fruit. Love this!!

Batch 1 375mL bottle at Deep Ellum, Summer 2012Perfect appearance for a gueuze, bottle conditioned and with the sediment dropped out. Fluffy white head recedes to cover atop a light, brassy gold with plentiful bubbles rising.Very lactic in the nose, with a high strength of aroma. Much of the cleanliness of 3F but with a bit of the sulphur from early-mid 2000s Cantillon. Tons of band-aid and green apple. Probably would confuse this for/guess this to be a softer vintage of Girardin in a blind tasting.Very expressive brett in the flavor, with light acetone and a fair amount of green apple. The sourness clears quickly, much moreso than Cantillon and with more body than 3F and Girardin. Acetic finish. Dosent seem any stronger than your average 5% gueuze, which is nice.I cant even imagine starting a Belgian lambic brewery and this being your first offering. Classy and very authentically done. Cheers and I look forward to more from them!

375 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 12/20/2022. Pours lightly hazy golden amber color with a 2-3 finger foamy and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice dense soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a large amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big lemon/lime zest, green apple, pear, white grape, oak, clove, hay, straw, grass, leather, pepper, white vinegar, musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky yeast and barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon/lime zest, green apple, pear, white grape, oak, clove, pepper, hay, straw, grass, leather, light bread, musty funk, white vinegar, and yeast earthiness. Moderate earthy/fruity tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon/lime zest, green apple, pear, white grape, hay, straw, grass, oak, clove, pepper, leather, musty funk, white vinegar, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Incredible complexity and balance of fruity/funk yeast oak barrel flavors; with a great balance of malt/acidity with zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very crisp, smooth, and moderately acidic mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding Gueuze! All around awesome complexity and balance of fruity/funky yeast and oak barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on with the moderate acidity. A highly enjoyable offering.
375 ml bottle @ home. Cork opens with a huge pop. Pours hazy golden with some off white head. Aroma is tart with green apples and grapes. Taste is funky, mildly sour with grapes. Lots of carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a clear pale gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice funky dryness with sour light fruits and a good amount of acid. Flavor starts with sour lemons and light fruits with a good amount of funk and a dry finish.
Golden in colour. Great white head. Aroma of grapefruit, lemon. Bit of hay aroma. Sour with a hint of vinegar. Little vanilla aroma in background. Very good gueuze. Enjoyed it.

A sharp floral tartness in the aroma. Pearlesent glowing gold with micro fine constant bubbles. Smooth tart bordering on rubbery and then float towards fruity as it rinses. Smooth clean wet as it runs through your mouth leaves light sourness behind. Amazing balance huge complex sour taste, amazing.

Pours a dark sparkling golden color with minimal white head. Smell is funky and lemon cheese. Taste is sour and fruity with some grape and lemon.

Bottle at Kaisla. Hazy orange color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, tart, earthy notes, peach and apple. Sour finish with citrus, tart and apple. Very nice gueuze.

Had at a tasting at 28 Springs. Pours a golden yellow with a faint white head. Aroma is apricots and lemons. Slight sourness. Flavor is dried apricots and somewhat bitter. Very dry. Very nice beer. Thanks Casey!

From a bottle aged 2010-2011. Pours dark apricot. Aroma of horseblanket, funky fruit, cheese. Medium carbonation and big mouthfeel. Flavors of funky, sour fruit with slight bitterness and mouth puckering components.
Poured from a 375ml bottle, thanks to Doug. The aroma is peach, dusty, lemon. The flavor is peach, lemon, slight grape note. This is a strongly acidic beer.
Une geuze surprenante, acide et sauvage mais bien buvable tout de meme. La base est chouette est pas seche du tout, malgres les levures vorace elle garde une belle structure gourmande.
Bottle, many thanks to Countbeer. Hazy orange golden color with small head. Tart aroma with funk, basement aromas. Tart taste with vinous notes, lemon, grapefruit, oak. Tart finish. Good.
Bottle, courtesy of Cuso. Pours hazy oragne color, white head. Aroma is yeasty, sourish, acidic, lemon. Taste is extra sour, acidic, lemon, wood. My style#65.

Bottle. Completely hazy orange colour. Aroma is weirdly yeasty (I am not used to this). Taste is strong sour, with some supporting fruity sweetness (brings to mind peaches). Overall character is mostly yeasty. Nice experience, though not exactly to my taste.

Poured from bottle. Nice pour with lots of effervescence and characteristic cloudy, orange color. Perfect amount of Brett funk on the nose and beloved horse blankety goodness. Great palate with lots of small bubbles followed by appropriate sourness and a clean finish. This is a great gueuze and one you can fairly readily find in the US.

Champagne-like maize colored beer with a highly active dissipating white head. Mouth-puckering funky aromas, lightly grassy and distinctly European. Flavor was strongly but not overwhelmingly tart and the mouthfeel was clean and crisp with carbonation with lightly lingering sourness. I would drink it any day.
Bottle, pours pristine topaz with foamy persistent head. Rich barnyardy, musty aroma. Super lemony, clean, with just a bit of funk. Finishes brightly tart. Excellent.
Smak och doft av jäst, gröna äpplen, gröna vindruvor, gul kiwi, citrus, citron med örtiga toner. Syrlig, frisk med vinös karaktär. Tydlig beska. Väldigt trevlig.

375 ml bottle. 2012-2013 edition. Pours like pale cider with quickly disappearing white foamy head. Citrus, apples and yeast in aroma and taste.

I had this on draught while in Brussels, it was fantastic.
Vintage 2010-2011

Pours a murky golden with a withering finger of white foam. The beer is not much to look at. Smells good and funky with lemon, manure, grass, vitamin, and some hints of peppery sharpness. Smells like its gonna be tart!

Tart with lemons, and some baking soda character. Nice and dry with a mouth watering finish. Sharp carbonation brings out the lemony sourness and the remaining effervescence leaves a nice medicinal flavor mixed with a good funk. A little much on the alka-seltzer quality at times for me. 

Overall a good beer, better when I was in Brussels at a bar (but what beer isnt?). I am hesitant to purchase again given the price tag. Maybe grab a bottle and do a good sized gueuze tasting here in a few. Maybe a couple for the cellar, see how they mature.

tiny white head disappears fast. copper murky colour. aroma of brett-funk, strawberry, maize, hay, sulphur. taste citric acid, grapefruit, bit wry. dry mouthfeel, medium body and carbonation. nice one.
Bottle, says "2010-2011". Pours hazy gold white head. Nose of lemon, barnyard, wood. Flavour is same, prickly carbonation, finish is quite sour. Excellent stuff.

Bottle at Akkurat.

Head is initially small, fizzy/frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy dark yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly to moderately yeasty (cobwebs, barnyard), with notes of green grape, lemon/lime, sour apple, kiwi.

Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately to heavily acidic.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately to heavily acidic, lightly bitter.

Medium body, velvety/fluffy texture, lively/fizzy carbonation.

Excellent stuff in terms of what I like in geuze...vibrant aroma (very fruity) and wonderful balance (neither too sweet nor too sour for my taste)...and a surprisingly fluffy mouthfeel for the style. Most geuze by nature is watery and fizzy, but this sample had a superb velvety texture. Really enjoyed this.

2011 bottle. Aroma is sour with grassy notes. Appearance is the most beautiful golden I've ever seen in a beer. Taste is sour upfront with a malt whiskey background and clean with a great effervescence. Very tiny almost champagne like bubbles. One of the best gueuze I've ever had.

375ml bottle pours a hazy, pulpy orange with some thin, white head. Very nice nose, mouth watering tartness, pithy, some candy, lots of medicine cabinet, grassy, some nettles, a little stinky cheese rind. Flavor has a moderate level of acid and tartness, some candy sugar, grapefruit peel, pithy, funk, some band aid, grass. Funky finish, but not too acidic. I am hanging on to bottles for a while because I am interested to see how this develops in the bottle. Lacks the acid the great gueuzeries produce, but still very drinkable. I cant regularly get Cantillon, so for now, I will regularly buy this.

Bottle to glass. Pours a slightly hazy light amber color with a thin fizzy off-white head. Aroma is a bit dry on the nostrils, with some light acetic acid and citrusy fruit notes. Flavor brings out the acetic acid notes and is moderately sour. Light sweetness hidden in there. Tingly on the palate with a lingering sour on the back of the tongue. Delicious.
Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with an off white head. Aroma is sour, fresh apples, some wheat and yeast. Taste is quite sour and light sweet. Medium body with average carbonation.

Bottle at Nuetnigenough. Fair degree of carbonation, not much head. Curious retro label. Initially found the aroma sweet, although a second go unleashed some sour notes. The Tilquin gueuzes appear well blended, sweeter, with less aggressive sharpness or sourness than say a Cantillon. A nice winey fruitiness. Good.
Bottle. Orange color with small white head. Green apples, citrus, apricots in aroma. Taste is sour and fruity, medium body, pleasant mouthfeel. Finish is long, sour and bitter.

DAA; My No. 200. 2011/2012 bottle. BB 21.03.22. 37,5 cl. Pours hazy orange, white fading head. Aroma is sour, citrus, green apples, fruit and grass. Taste of green apples, citrus, sour, yeast and pepper. Complex nose and flavour. Light spritzy and dry. Refreshing, lasting fruity, citrus dry finish.
Fizzy and festive! Nice sour sting in the taste. Citrus, berries, and earthy notes dominate.

2012/2013 bottle, 11/18/2013. Pours cloudy ruddish amber, fluffy white head dies to a nice crema on the surface, great retention, lacing built up around the edges. Aroma is strong earthy barnyard, light horse blanket, mild green apple and fleshy grapefruit, citrus and oak. Taste is soft green apple and light citrus tartness, bitter grapefruit, earthy funk and dry wood finish. Full, round body, silky carbonation. Really great.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Ar: lovely funky aroma, lots of fruitiness, barnhouse aromas, tart, Green apples.
Ap: hazy amber colour, medium white head.
T: big tartness, lemon, low bitterness, lovely funkiness.
P: medium body, lots of carbonation, tart finish.
O: lovely big tartness.

Bottle. Moderate grain for the malt, dried flowers and grass for the hops, musty basement for the yeast, with hints of white grape, green wood and mixed berries. Head is average to large, fizzy/frothy. white with no lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is hazy medium amber with some small pieces in it. Flavor starts heavily acidic, acetic and sour, then finishes harshly acidic, moderately to heavily bitter and acidic. Palate is medium, dry, with a lively carbonation and a moderately astringent finish and leaves a tingle in the back of your mouth. By the smell and taste of it I can tell its a Gueuze lovers dream, but this just aint my style.

Pours orange with a fading head.
Nose shows elderflower, gooseberries, green apple, soft horseblanket, light skunky notes. Quite a big apple juice character.
Flavours include tart green apples, old hops, gooseberries, horseblanket and a bold acidity.
Carbonation feels excessive.

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark orange colour with a small and off-white head. Sour aroma of barnyard and horses, heather, rowanberries, forest floor, vinegar and citric acid. The flavour follows up and feels a bit sweeter but is still pretty sour. Lots of sour and sweet berries. Smooth and slick mouth feel, and a light berry bitterness. A very nice and well balance gueuze.
Wonderful lemon, grape skin and vinegar aroma. Nice citrus base and gassy tonic flavour is very fresh and quenching. Highly recommended.
750ml bottle pours a straw yellow with a frothy white head. Lemon oak and funk aroma. Tart lemon orange and apricot taste.

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some LIght, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Lemons, Earthy, Funky, Mild Apricot

T: Lemons, Sour Mash, Bitter Apricot

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Sour, Semi Bitter

Overall, this is was you should expect out of a decent gueuze, not a Cantillon in quality but definitely drinkable and available everywhere.

Bottle from Tipples. Pours a deep hazy orange color with only a small ring of fizzy white head. Aroma of sour vinegar, some minty effervescence, orange peel, apricots, cherry, green apple. This smells glorious. Flavor is big green apple, sour vinegar, some candy sugar. Effervescent but not as much carb as I expected, easy drinking, mouth puckering. Overall I like this a lot, even more so than Drie Fontenin'a Oude Gueze. Nice beer.
de couleur dore elle degage des arome agrume comme le plamplemousse en bouche c est un sur melanger a du plamplemousse tres agreable biere d ete ou apéro (rate145)

Bottle. From walts cellar. Shared with friends while telling stories and missing the oompa loompa. Hazed tan body with a minimal head. Sweaty aroma that promises a great tasting beer. Full body earthy sour with a berry note. Leather flavor keeps emerging. Sweaty leather, a beer for the bondage fans. Apparently ratman burned down an elementary school. Or i wasnt listening well.

Popped the cork and expected massive funk based on the reviews here, but I am happy to report this is dominated mostly by candy apple, lemon, and mustard seed. Its strong, but well-balanced. The appearance is also quite nice - cloudy orange-gold with a frothy off-white head. Taste is sour lemon, horseradish, acid, vinegar, and green apple. While I would not go for this style regularly - I can only take sours, Brett, etc. in small doses - it was great to try this out and find its not as funky, footy, and cheesy as Ive sometimes read. So yeah, Im highly picky about sour/funky beer, but this took me by surprise.

15cl. from bottle at Brassigaume 2013. Pours a hazy golden colour with a good white head. Aroma is sour. Tastes sour with a light bitter suttle sweet fruity end. Medium to low carbonation. I think it should be a little more cooler.

Very smooth geuze. Perhaps not the tastiest, but very smooth good drinkability indeed.
From Premier Gourmet.

(Bottle, 2010/2011) Golden amber colour with frothy, off-white head. Fruity, spicy nose with grapefruit, green grapes, barnyard, hay, peaches, white bread and hints of clove. Fruity, tart taste with lemon, grapefruit, hay, unripe green grapes, white bread, apricots and a dry and tart finish with a soft and balanced acidity. Medium body, dry. Excellent gueuze: tasty, tart and well balanced. Lovely beer!
Really nice and fruity and bitter and sweet and sour and acidic gueuze - frankly on of the best of these lambics Ive tried. Great experience, and much more exciting than fx a bottle of champagne.

375mL bottle 2011-2012 vintage
Hazy orange body with pretty much no head.
Good funky aroma; vinous citrus - grapefruit, lemon rind, bitter orange marmalade - white vinegar, subtle oak influence, with a bit of pale cereal character, a faint hint of washed rind cheesy funk
Highly effervescent carbonation, light on the body, with appreciable citric/acetic acidity.
Citrus continues on the palate - more grapefruit & lemon rind, vinegar, cheesy, slightly horsey funk. Drops away to a somewhat abrupt watery finish, with a mild bitterness and bit of tannic grip.
A very decent Lambic, perhaps not as complex/intense as others ive come across. Nice and funky nonetheless.
UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 Big thanks go to tectactoe on splitting this one. Super funky smell as you pop the cork. Huge funky, sour, lemon, citrus flavors here. Very tart. Awesome beer.

Very clean and soft for the style. Sweet, well balanced with nice lemon and oaky notes. Very refreshing stuff. A good start for the beginners. Draft version is fantastic, even better than the bottle one.

Great aroma. Lovely yellow gold with a fine head. I paired it with mac & cheese adding Pt. Reyes blue cheese to it. Fantastic together. Lemon and sharp bitterness from the barrel. Creamy and soft. Loved it.

Bottle - 375ml. Hazy golden body with good carbonation and an average white foamy head. Strong hoppy aroma with fruity (mainly citrusy), malty, and herbal hints. Its sharp hoppy taste carries woody, citrusy, malty, and herbal notes. Ends with a long sour finish. Very good example of Gueuze.

bottle, enjoyed at mowbeers 30th birthday party. yellow with a light haze and a short-lived spritzy head; loads of damp cellar in the aroma; some tart rotting lemon rind, cheesecake, old rag; crisp and invigorating

375 mL bottle at Seven Monks in Traverse City.  A golden amber pour with a white head.  Aroma is quite sour.  Flavor of sour raspberry or strawberry, funk, lemon, dry.  Maybe not the most complex, but "sooooo good" (quote from notebook).  Those words definitely do not describe how much I enjoyed this, so Ill just let the numbers do that.

bottle at bierhuyske
pours rather dark blond for a geuze
small white head

taste is mouthfilling sour . like a sharper boon , or a balder 3 fonteinen withoud the funk . 
not realy complex, too much carbo . OK but not the best one for sure

37,5 cl bottle @ Durty Nellys Pub, Borgomanero (NO), Italy.
Pours a clear, golden liquid with a frothy clean white head, dissipating in about a minute. I get mostly apples on the notes, with hints of cellar dust, hay, balsamic vinegar. Not one of the most acidic gueuzes, really pleasant, cleans the palate quite nicely and leaves and apple-y and slightly balsamic note. I find it more easily approachable than other lambics. Cant detect the alcohol at all.
Pours a golden beer with a good white head. Smells deliciously sour. Tastes great. Medium sour with a light bitter suttle sweet finish. Average carbo. Thin body and a watery texture.

Bottle, 375 ml. Pours dark golden with a big creamy head. Aroma is balsamic vinegar, oak and notes of earth, as well as a funky fruity hint of brett. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is sour with funky yeast and brett, as well as wood and fruit giving a nice long tart finish.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours clear golden yellow, with a lively white head. Immediate aroma of white grapes, lemon, green apple peel and a nice farmhouse funk. Smells really clean, unlike some older lambics Ive had. Flavours are crisp - tart citric zest, lemongrass, green apple balanced a nice dry sourness. Great gueuze in my opinion.

Che meraviglia infinita, aspetto, aroma, palato incredibili, mia moglie ha detto che è una delle cose in assoluto più buone che abbia mai assaggiato. Addirittura lultimo sorso col fondo, mi sembrava di sentire odor di tabacco nei bar fumosi, fantastico...
Bottle. I have had very few lambics. Pour is a hazy gold with some white head. Aroma is tart funk. Flavor is tartness followed by tons of funk. Not sure how to evaluate the funk, but its terrific.

12.7oz bottle. Pours a hazy straw color with moderate carbonation and a thin white head. Smells of funk and lemon and cloves. Taste is sour with lemon and mild orange peel bitterness. Finish is lingering yogurt sourness. Thin but slightly oily mouthfeel. A very nice and drinkable lambic.

Bottle thanks to CanIHave4Beers! Solid delicious gueuze. A fresh, banyardy funkiness. Moderately sour. Very drinkable, balanced, refreshing mouthfeel.
750ml bottle. Hazy orange-tan, Oily head, steady rims the glass. Classic funked out barnyard aroma. Lemony and sour, but completely drinkable. Easy going, very authentic. World Class, well done.

Bottle @ Elfos Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with an orange, hazy colour, small off-white head. Aroma has notes of leather, citrus, barnyard, basement aromas and wood. Taste is moderately sweet, little bitter, moderately sour; well balanced. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.
750 ml. bottle. Pours a hazy light gold with a nice white head. Aroma of funk, citrus, and wood. Taste is lemon, funk, wood, and florals. Nice and tart.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2014 Bottle from Mane Liquor at PBS tasting. Good looking stuff. Nose is very barnyard like with hay, grass, bread and some astringent acidity there. Very easy going Gueuze thats for sure. Taste is slightly vinegary with some acidity and heavy barnyard notes - citrus, horse blanket, hay. Very quaffable. Considering this was side by side with Armand and Tommy, it held its own. Very good and I couldnt pick a preferred one

Bright gold with 5 mm of head that is fairly quick to decay to a flat surface. Aroma/flavor is pickles and tart pear, barn hay, and, specific to the flavor, an evolution to dry wheaty grain about a half second in. The sourness is clean, fruity, and on the heavy side of moderate for the style, but I prefer less. Body is light, a bit foamy. a nice Geuze, but Im not sure if its worth its current rating.

75cl bottle. Hazy orange color with a huge white head. Aroma is citrus, barnyard and vinegar. Flavor is sour with lemon and some green apples. Dry and quite light bodied. Not overly sour but very tasty and balanced.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2016 (corked 330ml bottle)   . Drank from a Cantillon tulip... bottle dates 2011-2012 Funky barnyard refreshing complexity . Dryness that cleans your soul and a tart accent that melts your mind... but not the cost interestingly complex or challenging of gueuzes

Delicately balanced, restrained complexities of white, yellow, orange, and green fruit, creamy barrel, and silky horse blanket

UPDATED: APR 30, 2014 If you want to smell & taste banryard (doh), wild yeast, apricot jam, light oaky, this is your beer. Complex but round & smooth mouthfeel. Utterly balanced.
