text: Hazy yellow colour. Smells cellar and sour. Tastes acidic, sour, some fruits. Long aftertaste, bit dry.
375 mL bottle at Churchkey. Some similarities to the draft version but with much more must, dark funk, and added complexities and nuances, lots of Cantillon-like hints. Very nice.
Belin che buona, sempre bene che nascano nuovi blender di lambic come si deve

(bottle, 75 cl) Golden to ochre colour, foamy, unstable head. Medium sour taste, hardly any bitterness, even compared to other oude gueuzes. UPDATED: DEC 4, 2011 30th July 2011ChrisOs Donkey Dork Lord Pre-GBBF Tasting. Cloudy gold beer, small off white head. Light dry palate. Mildly sour - white wine vinegar with some unsweet wood. 750 ml bottle poured a hazy orange amber with a small lingering off white head. Aromas of sour citrus, straw and horseblanket. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of straw, sour citrus and horse blanket with a crisp dry tartlingering funky finish.
Had this one @ In De Wildeman. Hazy golden, orange colored brew. Very soft, accessible, not very sour, balanced. Nice.
Bottle @ RBESG, London 2011. Pours cloudy golden with a small white head. Barnyard, cellar , lemon and grapefruit. Tart and prickly. Smooth and refreshing. Great!

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2011 Didnt realize Id ticked this one and had two separate ratings in the draft listing: one for draft at Moeder and one for bottle at DHvL. DHvL bottle, "lAncienne": Hazy yellow-gold, heavy white lacing. Citrus and must in the nose, also fresh acetic acid, sweat, and some dust. Flavor is immediately lemon, grapefruit, and light dust, overall a bit flat at the front, better when the salt, dust, and lightly stinging acid arrive later. Very puckering, juicy, quenching with perfectly stinging carbonation. Lovely stuff at times.

Bottle 0,375ltr: Hazy orange coloured brew with an fruity smell at the start, very well balanced sour taste and dry bitter finish. Good Gueuze from Wallonia, and good one to learn to drink this spontanious fermented beer style.

375 ml bottle.  4.8% version. Cloudy gold, medium white head, solid lacing. Aroma of dusty lemon citrus, stone fruits, animals.  Taste has grapefruit and lemon. More complex than the draught version.  Nice character and complexity.
Bottle (Grand Tasting at RBESG 2011, London) at Dean Swift. Cloudy golden - white head. Wooden, horsey, earthy, nice sourness, wooden, citrus, light gooseberries. Lovely.

courtesy of the Erzbierschofs - cloudy blond beer with a nice head retention; aroma of cobweb, vinegar and cheese; apples appear too; medium-bodied and tasty, a fait acidity, creamy and with a long dusty, fruity and vinegar-like aftertaste

75cl bottle at home kindly shared by oj83. This was a really nice geuze that reminded me of the lindemans Cuvee Rene. It was light and spritzy with a very smooth palate. Quite a citrusy lambic which reminded me of a watered down Cantillon Geuze. Very nice and refreshing but perhaps lacking complexity....this may change with age.

Thick white head, lagery like color, lots of gas bubbles in liquid. Smell is sour. Taste is sour as well. Very down to earth basement beer. Something in aroma reminds sauerkraut. This is a beer belongs to category nice to have, but not in large large quantities, second bottle would be too much for the night.

Haalean oranssinen ja samea Oude Gueuze Tilquin on on melkoinen omena ja sitrus hapatus.  Sen vaahto katoaa kovin nopeasti. Sen tuoksusta voi aistia happamuuden ja hedelmäisyyden, eikä juurikaan muuta. Tässä tapauksessa ominaisuudet ovat vain sen verran herkullisia, että vaikkei olut loista julmetulla monimuotoisuudella, on olut kuitenkin erittäin maukas. Suuhun kaadettaessa olut on erittäin kirpeä ja hapan. Kokonaisuudessaan maanläheinen ja hedelmäinen pommi.

A: The beer pours a hazy orange color with a big white head that dies down somewhat quickly.

S: A very funky nose nose to this with a lot of the must and sweaty sock type of smells you get out of Drie Fonteinen beers.  Lots of grass and green apples with a mild oak note and quite a bit of citrus.

T: The citrus and sweaty sock funk stand out quite well.  Still plenty of grass and must, with a very earthy note that is reminiscent of mushrooms.  As with the aroma, a mild oak note, but overall, the flavor is not quite as good as aroma.

M: The body is medium with medium to high carbonation.

O: This is a really nice gueuze.  I would be happy to have this again.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2011 Tilquin. 750ml bottle courtesy of Shawn for sharing this limited offering... Pours a semi-vivid apricot hue, mostly opaque, and topped with a thin flimsy soapy white head... Typical geueze-like aroma with its unique horseblanket funkiness. A softer grassiness on the backend. Solid but totally unique... Flavors follow suit quite consistently to what the aroma suggests. Grassy green with a modicum of funkiness. Soft to lighter than medium bodied with a lighter level of carbonation. Solid but standard but quite drinkable.
7/4/8/4/15

75 cl bottle. Pours copper orange with only the smallest head. Aroma is very fruity, mainly citrus and some green apples. Not overly sour in the taste, so its very drinkable due to its softness. Medium bodied and very palatable. If this new blender can continue to progress, Im sure he will deliver top products in the near future. Good to see that someone is willing to invest in Geuze.
Bottle @ home, shared with DutchDrebus. Hazy yellow color, average white head. Smell sour and a little musty. Decent sour taste though carbo and body are a little disappointing.

75 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and citrusy to slight grapefruity. Smooth fruity, acidic and lingering sweet fruity impression. Dry citric and crisp fruity into the finish. Fresh and fruity.

This was terrific -- funk bomb!  Normally I have to get my nose right into a glass to smell it, but upon arrival to our table the barnyard made its presence known immediately.    Really quite special.    The head was pretty strong too, unusually for a gueuze on tap.    From what Ive heard, this is better in the bottle -- if so, I have to get a bottle just as soon as I can.

Sampled from the bottle at a tasting in Chicago with Kan and friends. Gold orange in color with a plentiful white head. Aromas are of barnyard, earth, and funk. Very pleasant in your mouth. Tart sour qualities of lemon, tangerine, orange. The brett character is perfect on this beer. The finish is balanced with citrus and tartness. Very tasty beer and would love to have some of this treat. Thanks guys.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2012 
375 ml bottle from Ohtsuki. Nice leather, lemon, slight soap, dust nose. Well integrated. Bright deepngolden, very effervescent, tall, fine head. Well sour flavor, lemony, with leather, salt, and dust. Very crisp and tasty, with quite a bit of sweetness in there as well, but a dry, bitter finish. Straightforward and good. Not the most complex gueuze maybe, but very nice. Very well carbonated.      
Bottle at Chrisos shared by Chriso, 2011. Pretty peach orange to pink color with lace. Huge tangy lemon and lmon zest nose. Yeah! Sweet-and-sour flavor, quite sweet and fruity, actually, maybe too much so, with restrained sourness and reasonably complex. 8/3/7/4/15

Bottle at chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 11. It pours hazy yellow-orange, with a decent off-white head and moderate carbonation. The nose is farmyard, lemon, lime and sour green apple. The taste is sour green apple, lemon, lime, pear, ripe sweet red apple, peach and wood, with a dry, tart finish. Great balance and very, very drinkable. Ticks all the boxes this one does. I wouldnt have a problem polishing off a few bottles of this by myself.
Säuerlicher, fast etwas salziger Antrunk. Wenig herb, trocken und holzig (passend). Frisch, die Säure ist ausgewogen. Bitter-säuerliches Finish, adstringent. Nett! 10/12/11/13//12
bottle at chriss .. hazy yellow ... funky barnyard lemon sour ... sour tart lemon ... zezt ... funky .. not me

Bottle This beer rocks! Pours cloudy and golden with a small, fizzy, white head. The aroma is a funky, earthy mélange of barnyard, horse blanket, straw and citric acidity. Full-bodied with a dry mouthfeel and laid-back carbonation. The flavor is fruity and barnyardy. Sour for sure, but yeasty bitterness nearly balances things out. Tart, bready, mildly bitter, bone-dry finish. Dstructo is the man. Thanks, Ryan!

Bottled. Big thanks to chriso. Hazy dark yellow with diminishing head. Rich aroma from barnyard, citrus and grapefruit. Dry woody in mouth and juicy with good balance and soft acidity. Highly drinkable.

Always nice to see a new Oude Geuze (a bit of an internal contradiction there). Tilquin is good already, but should improve, since this is an Oude Geuze based only on young and 2 year old lambic. Pierre told me that he had to do this to start getting some of his investments back. Next year however, he WILL be using 3 year old lambic as well, namely the lambic from Cantillon. This first version DOES NOT contain lambic from Cantillon (sorry to all that included notes on the distinguished Cantilon flavours etc :-p) . Still a good Oude Geuze though... even now! nice and mals, just flows inside... mmmm

Big thanks to destructo for sharing this bottle.  A hazy golden shade of winter with a fluffy white head.  Aromas of stinky Irish feet.  Wild funk, sour citrus, tart grapefruits and apples, earthy yeast.  Good stuff....
Hazy golden/yellow with medium white head. Flaovur is malt, wheat, tart, wood, little baryard, citrus and sour.

(750ml bottle, BB 11/12/2020)  Pours a cloudy golden body with a medium off-white head.  Aroma of grapefruit, grass, lemon, mustiness, green apple, barnyard, florals, and earth.  Flavor of grapefruit, lemon, florals, and earthiness with a dry oak finish.  Cantillon really shines through. An excellent start for this new blender.
Nice smooth, hazy orange, mo head, aprikots, citric, med tart. Lingering fresh and sourness.

(Bottle, 0.375 l, at Gastropub Tuulensuu, 20110719) The beer poured orange and cloudy. Its head was small and white. Aroma had sourness, grapefruit, vomit and fruitiness. Palate was medium bodied and a little bit dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were sourness, grapefruit, fruitiness, wood and bitterness. Aftertaste was sour, woody and fruity. A very good mixture of lambics from four sources letting their styles to show and still being original. I hope to be able to try more.

750 ml bottle shared at Kans. Thanks! Pours a murky golden orange pour, a frothy bright white head, glowing and well hazed with a good ring, laces ok. Aromas are fresh citrusy oranges, lemons, and vibrant pineapple. Some melon, bread, and dough. Some dry florals are mellow, soft cheese, yogurt. Some light brettiness, some wet oak. Young, gentle funk compliments a vibrant fruity element. Initial is lighter bodied preaching sour lemons and grapefruit, pineapples, and grass. Bread, with soft cheese and yogurt, a touch of a sharp cheesiness cuts in, faint metal, growing citrus and moderate sour fruit element. Its sour, but not acidic, with a good fruity explosion. I dig this, a big fruity sour element, not moving into acidic instead throwing grapefruit, melons, lemons, and good growing sourness, fruit, with a touch of mango, more pineapple really asserts itself. Really nice, some prickly carbonation, jabs of acidity, growing sourness. Mmmmmm. Funk is light, soft, gentle, with just a touch of oak. Some soft cheese and yogurt, playing second fiddle to the fruity sourness for sure. Really nice, wins me over.

Bottled.  Hazy golden, rich head. Enormous cobweb and barnyard aroma. Citric and lemony. Dry and soft with medium body. Drie Fonteinen-like relaxed softness, blanced citric acidity. Superbly drinkabkle and vastin character.

Bottle at Den Zytholoog, Adegem. Cloudy, deep golden with a smallish head. Strong lemony lambik nose, hints of talc and wood. Quite acidic flavours with lemony and woody dryness. Well-carbonated. The chalkiness of the Girardin shines through, as does the sharp lemony Cantillon lambik. A masterpiece is born.

0.375 l bottle at Tuulensuu, Tampere. Hazy deep golden color. Sharp acidic aroma with lemon, grapefruit, sulfur and citrus pith. The taste is also acidic but smoother than aroma. Lots of lemon and grapefruit with hint of mustard. Nice gueuze of its own kind.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2011 Bottle. Pours sparkling orange. Quickly dissipating white head. Nose and taste of tart lemon, oak and funk. Lightly buttery in a good way. Medium body. Moderate tartness. Simple yet elegant. Well balanced. Body a little on the light side. Good carbonation.

Bottled 750ml (PBF, vintage 2011)
Hazy orange color, small white head. Tart fruity Cantillon-like aroma. Medium-bodied. Tart, leathery and fruity flavor. Very good drinkability. Lingering tartness in the aftertaste. I think Cantillon dominates in this blend. Super.

Bottled (thanks Chriso). Hazy orange colour, small head. Quite lively. Aroma is tart wood, some fruits, mild earth as well as some mild berries as well. Flavour is tart wood, some earth, mild sour fruits as well as some earthyness. Pleasantly balanced.

Pours a cloudy orange-straw color. Larger than normal head on a gueuze. Dies down pretty quickly and leaves a little bit of lacing. Fruity aroma, peppery, leather, and a bit of sourness. No real funk, just a slight bit of earthiness. Big sour taste right up front. Very tart and a very sour mouthfeel. Very good beer for this guys first time out. Cant wait to see how they age, and what hell have in store for us next.

750 ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. BBE 11/12/2020.
Pours a hazy, yellowish copper colour with a small white head on the edges. Aroma of sour, tart apples, some vinegar and fresh lemons. Flavour of sour apples, clove, lemon, lime and oak. Medium bodied with a thick mouthfeel and a lovely sour, dry, tart, citrusy finish with a fair amount of acidity. Lively carbonation. Pleasant gueuze which will probably be even better after a few years.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2011 75 cl bottle @ Tuulensuu, BBE 11/12/2020
Started coming spontaneously out of the bottle in form of a foam. Sour and fruity aroma with some fruity peachness. Taste is sour with a hint of lactacic acid like in the Tilquin Lambic Blend. An average gueuze.

Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Rating #5100. Marked as best before 11/12/2020. Pours with a hazy golden body with a small white head that fades to a ring and lingers around the side of the glass. Aromas are huge, very funky (a complex and deep funk), white wine, brett, oak. Some horseblanket, honey, esters and florals. Very complex. Flavors are again, complex. Funk, musty, dried stone fruits, lively, bright. Rich wood notes, horseblanket, honeysuckle with balancing tannins. White wine vinous notes. Lively bubbles with decent acidity, bright, and dry. A very nice new Gueuze from a new blender. Leans a bit to the funk side of things over the sharper acidity of a Cantillon or 3Font. A bit like 1882, but clearly its own. Very nice!

Short-lived, just off-white head over dullish orange-ochre, well-carbonated gueuze. Citrussy, farmyard odour, flowery as dried flowers or helicrysum; generally quite Cantillon-like, sour apples, touch of sulphur. Very citrussy taste again, lemony; lipsmacking sour flavour. Again quite Cantillon-character, but it lacks a bit of depth, seemingly falling a bit dead. Sandcookies retronasal, before the citrussy acidity takes over the aftertaste. Farmyard, flowery touches and soldatenkoeken. Very refreshing, light, totally overattenuated, quite dry. A bit more ripening, a bit more applied blending, and this becomes a top-gueuze. Im sure it will, but I would diminish the amount of Cantillon lambic a bit, and use more oude lambik.

bouteille 37.5cl bouchonnée dans le verre Tilquin.. 
Il est rare dassister à la naissance dune nouvelle gueuzerie, encore plus rare quand cette dernière est à côté de chez soi.
Cest donc heureux que jouvris cette bouteille.
La couleur est dorée laissant séchapper un tourbillon de bulles qui viennent percer la surface dun col blanc soyeux.
Au nez, je retrouve là toute la complexité dune gueuze artisanale, offrant ici un côté de moisi/renfermé avec une touche fruitée mais aussi une signature qui rappelle la Cantillon pour tout ceux qui en on déjà bu ou se sont déjà promenés à Cantillon.
En bouche, on retrouve ce palais de chêne donnant un fini boisé avec une certaine acidité allant vers différentes agrumes. Là aussi jidentifie encore Cantillon pour une bière qui donne un palais sec et laisse une effervescence qui vient chatouiller le palais.
Une très bonne gueuze, et qui demande à être revisitée dans le futur voire aussi à ouvrir une bouteille dans qcq années pour voir comment cette dernière aura évoluer.

375mL thanks to Travlr. The pour is a hazy, glowing light orange. A thick, dense, off-white head erupts with excellent retention for gueuze. Nose is obviously Cantillon house funk (part of this blend) with sharp grapefruit and lemon peel, peach fruit leather, sweet ruby red grapefruit fleshy pulp. Very fresh, tropical, awesome nose. Reminds me of Girardin and Cantillon blended. Taste is quenching grapefruit, fresh and pulpy grapefruit juice, bitter citrus. Very zippy and fresh with loads of tropical notes and peach. Really superb. Hilariously on target for a first batch. A new geuze blender with some mad talent.

02/06/2011 37.5cl bottle @ Klaas place - BB: 22/12/2020 (2011-248)  Thanks to John for sharing the bottle! 
Pretty cloudy light orange beer, practically no head. Aroma: lemons and lime, typical bretta nose, basement. MF: little carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty sour start, lemony and bretts, pretty surprisingly bitter touch also. Aftertaste: sour, orange peel and zest bitterness. Not bad. Maybe a bit young still. Time will tell.

Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110528]

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 750 ml bottle opened at the US debut in Philadelphia at Monks Cafe - June 2011.
A: Hazy golden-wheat colored body.  Lively off-white head forms upon pouring.  Sticks around for a minute or two, leaving behind spotty lacing in the glass.
S: On the cleaner end of the gueuze spectrum.  A soft lemon citric aroma is central here.  My palate recognizes it as quintessential Girardin (which is one of the lambics blended into this).  Ever so slight mustyness.  
T: Like the nose, lemon-citrus dominates.  There is also a bit of sharper acidity which Id guess comes from the Cantillon lambic.  I found this to be decently complex.  Some constructive criticism would want a bit more earthiness.
M: Moderate effervescence.  Light to medium bodied.  Restrained sourness in the finish.  Acidity wasnt crazy.
O: I liked this.  Id put its flavor profile somewhere between Girardin and Cantillon, and while it could use more complexity, I think subsequent batches (or some age) will treat this well.  Hopefully it comes into the US market at a good price... cause Id gladly toss this into my normal line up with Cantillon, Drie Fonteinen, De Cam, and Girardin.

38cl, at 6%Vol, new exclusive brew Anno 2011, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex sour brew, fruity and slightly woody, balanced, cloudy, small head, good brew

I had this beer at the opening day of this new geuze blender. It is great to see that geuze beer is getting increasingly popular, and new blender evolve. Beer pours a nice golden color with a fluffy head. Smell is moderately funk, with hay and some citrus. Taste is a bit sour with a bitter finish. I miss the taste layers in this one. Overall a nice try, but this beer lacks complexity. Cannot stand up to the world class blends of Cantillon and Drie Fonteinen yet, but maybe that is because this geuze is only a blend of two years. I will closely follow their new releases next year, when they will blend 3 years of lambic for the first time. Really hope that that will improve the complexity and quality.

Very nice geuze! Beautiful amber color, foam stays long. Starts sour with a lightly bitter finish.

Bottle slightly before official release.  Clear golden with white head.  Tart, slightly yeasty aroma.  Tart flavor of grapefruit, blood orange and a hint of peach past the sour side.  Mild acid but balanced with light carbonation.  Good example of the style.
